subject: Re: [junit] Re: Can anyone help me see how to usefully work with JUnit in a big project, please?
msgSnippet: ... Here is some example code that uses it - I have this boilerplate Junit test that will toString, Equals, HashCode and getters and setters with very little
messageBody:
On 10/26/06, Tracey Annison <TAnnison@...> wrote:
>
> <SNIP>
> Get/Set tests are a pain, but I can indeed see that they're useful.
> In fact, they turned up two of the issues that JUnit's found for me,
> by exposing copy/paste errors. I haven't seen TestUtil before, but it
> sounds interesting - I'll have a look at that. Have you used it
> yourself?
> </SNIP>
>










Here is some example code that uses it - I have this boilerplate Junit test
that will toString, Equals, HashCode and getters and setters with very
little work - example of completed boilerplate below.

The method testAccessorsAddress below is all I do for each class to test
plain getters and setters.
The rest is boilerplate code for junit-addons to test equals/hashcodeand
Serializable complies with the general Java Contract of the same. toString
is also tested.

Junit Addons is here: http://junit-addons.sourceforge.net/

<CODE>

package blah.blah.model;

import java.io.Serializable;

import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;
import junitx.extensions.EqualsHashCodeTestCase;
import junitx.extensions.SerializabilityTestCase;

import com.gtcgroup.testutil.TestUtil;

/**
* Sample test - boilerplate
*/
public class DetailTypeTest extends TestCase {

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(DetailTypeTest.class);

suite.addTestSuite(EqualsHashCodeTest.class);
suite.addTestSuite(SerializabilityTest.class);
return suite;
}

/**
* Verify accessor methods
*/
public void testAccessorsAddress() {
assertTrue(TestUtil.verifyMutable(new DetailType()));
}

public void testToString() {
DetailType a = new DetailType();
a.setDescription("Some Description");
String expectedResult =
"DetailType[id=<null>,version=<null>,description=Some Description]";

assertEquals(expectedResult, a.toString());
}

/**
* <code>equals</code>/<code>hashCode</code> tests for the DetailType
* class.
*/

public static class EqualsHashCodeTest extends EqualsHashCodeTestCase {
public EqualsHashCodeTest(String name) {
super(name);
}

@Override
protected Object createInstance() {
DetailType a = new DetailType();
a.setDescription("Some Description");
return a;
}

@Override
protected Object createNotEqualInstance() {
DetailType b = new DetailType();
b.setDescription("Another Description");
return b;
}
}

/**
* Serializability tests for the DetailType class.
*/
public static class SerializabilityTest extends SerializabilityTestCase
{
public SerializabilityTest(String name) {
super(name);
}

@Override
protected Serializable createInstance() {
DetailType a = new DetailType();
a.setDescription("Some Description");
return a;
}
}
}



</CODE>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
